channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gaffes Color Biden’s High-Stakes Performance, and U.S. Inflation Cools
item.description: Plus, nursing homes are still failing residents.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.S. Officials See Hopeful Signs in Gaza Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: People briefed on the talks said it would be days until it is clear whether there was a breakthrough, and other officials cautioned that previous hopes had been dashed.

item.title: Shares of Uniqlo’s parent company drop almost 5% as the retailer warns of a ‘turning point’ in its China strategy
item.description: Fast Retailing, the Japanese owner of Uniqlo, is warning of large drops in profit and revenue from China, even as sales in other markets grow.

item.title: China Reaches Record Trade Surplus, Raising Alarm Abroad
item.description: China’s factories have begun an export blitz, prompting worries around the world about the effect on economies elsewhere.

item.title: Ambani Wedding Shows Off India’s New Gilded Age
item.description: Many Indians cheer the rise of moguls like Mukesh Ambani, whose son’s wedding has become a global spectacle. To them, India’s poverty is predictable, but such opulence is not.

item.title: Delta CEO says the Olympics is turning tourists off Paris—and it’s costing the airline $100 million
item.description: The Atlanta-based carrier has especially felt tourist’s aversion to the major sporting event because it services more American travel to France than any other US airline.

item.title: The Supreme Court’s Ultimate Psychological Manipulation
item.description: But the conservative justices can’t distance themselves from the significant damage they have caused.

item.title: Chandra Observatory Captures Two Supernovas in (Slow) Motion
item.description: For the 25th anniversary of the Chandra X-ray Observatory, NASA produced ghostly time-lapse videos of two centuries-old stellar explosions.

item.title: ‘Bond King’ Bill Gross says Tesla is the new meme stock with ‘sagging fundamentals’
item.description: Bill Gross said on X: "There seems to be a new meme stock every other day now. Most are pump and dump."

item.title: Five Takeaways From Biden’s News Conference
item.description: In a nearly hourlong news conference, the president defended his decision to stay in the race amid questions about his age and mental acuity, but also showed a command of foreign policy.

item.title: Rescued Hostage Describes Months of Uncertainty and Terror in Gaza
item.description: Andrey Kozlov was kept for six months in a family’s apartment by a Hamas operative who moonlighted as a journalist. Then Israeli commandos stormed in.

item.title: Angry birds are attacking drones employed to patrol NYC beaches for sharks and struggling swimmers
item.description: The attacks are fueling concern from wildlife experts about the impact on threatened species nesting along the coast.

item.title: Ambani Wedding Shows Off India’s New Gilded Age
item.description: Many Indians cheer the rise of moguls like Mukesh Ambani, whose son’s wedding has become a global spectacle. To them, India’s poverty is predictable, but such opulence is not.

item.title: U.K. Government Seeks Migration Miracle Worker, Preferably in Uniform
item.description: Britain’s new center-left government is moving quickly to tackle a challenge that bedeviled its predecessors: how to prevent migrants crossing the Channel and break up trafficking gangs.

item.title: Love Island stars prove they’re all about the content and not the crime as they plead guilty to FX allegations
item.description: Rebecca Gormley, Biggs Chris, Jamie Clayton, Lauren Goodger, Yazmin Oukhellou and Scott Timlin have all been charged.
